TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ClientChannelSinkStack extends System.Object implements class System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IClientChannelSinkStack, class System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IClientResponseChannelSinkStack
type ClientChannelSinkStack = class interface IClientChannelSinkStack interface IClientResponseChannelSinkStack

Docs.summary: Holds the stack of client channel sinks that must be invoked during an asynchronous message response decoding.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class makes a link demand. A security exception is thrown if the immediate caller does not have infrastructure permission. See [Link Demands](~/docs/framework/misc/link-demands.md) for more information.

Docs.permission: For operating with infrastructure code. Demand value: ; Permission Value:

Docs.param: The that the current stack can use to reply to messages.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified reply sink.

Docs.param: The headers that are retrieved from the server response stream.
The stream that is returning from the transport sink.
Docs.summary: Requests asynchronous processing of a method call on the sinks that are in the current sink stack.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.ClientChannelSinkStack.AsyncProcessResponse%2A> method initializes asynchronous processing on the top sink in the current sink stack. For additional information, see <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IClientChannelSink.AsyncProcessResponse%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

Docs.exception: The current sink stack is empty.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DispatchException (Exception e);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DispatchException(class System.Exception e) cil managed
Public Sub DispatchException (e As Exception)
public: virtual void DispatchException(Exception ^ e);
abstract member DispatchException : Exception -> unit override this.DispatchException : Exception -> unit

Docs.param: The exception to dispatch to the server.
Docs.summary: Dispatches the specified exception on the reply sink.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.ClientChannelSinkStack.DispatchException%2A> method dispatches the specified exception to the server through the reply sink that is specified in the constructor of the current sink stack. If the current sink stack was created without a reply sink, the exception is not transmitted, and no new exception is thrown.

MemberSignature.Value: public void DispatchReplyMessage (System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMessage msg);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void DispatchReplyMessage(class System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMessage msg) cil managed

abstract member DispatchReplyMessage : System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMessage -> unit override this.DispatchReplyMessage : System.Runtime.Remoting.Messaging.IMessage -> unit

Docs.summary: Dispatches the specified reply message on the reply sink.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.ClientChannelSinkStack.DispatchReplyMessage%2A> method dispatches the specified message to the server through the reply sink that is specified in the constructor of the current sink stack. If the current sink stack was created without a reply sink, the message is not transmitted, and no new exception is thrown.

Docs.param: The sink to remove and return from the sink stack.
Docs.summary: Pops the information that is associated with all the sinks from the sink stack up to and including the specified sink.
Docs.returns: Information generated on the request side and associated with the specified sink.
Docs.exception: The current sink stack is empty, or the specified sink was never pushed onto the current stack.

public: virtual void Push(System::Runtime::Remoting::Channels::IClientChannelSink ^ sink, System::Object ^ state);
abstract member Push : System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IClientChannelSink * obj -> unit override this.Push : System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IClientChannelSink * obj -> unit

Docs.param: The sink to push onto the sink stack.
Information generated on the request side that is needed on the response side.
Docs.summary: Pushes the specified sink and information that is associated with it onto the sink stack.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The information generated on the request side and specified in the `state` parameter is returned in the `state` parameter of the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Channels.IClientChannelSink.AsyncProcessResponse%2A> method on the corresponding sink.
